programme.title: NHL Hockey
programme.desc: Los Angeles has a four-game winning streak after defeating the Rangers, 3-1; Colorado has won five of its last six games overall and won its last two meetings with the Kings, including a 4-1 victory at Ball Arena on Nov. 13.

programme.title: 2025 NCAA Women's Basketball Tournament
programme.desc: LSU (30-5) third-straight Sweet 16 appearance with a 101-71 win over Florida State, and beat the Wolfpack, 82-65, on Nov. 27 behind 24 points from Mikaylah Williams; NC State (28-6) defeated Michigan State, 83-49, in the second round to advance.

programme.title: The Pat McAfee Show
programme.desc: Former NFL punter Pat McAfee and his friends deliver one-of-a-kind opinions on the latest news making headlines in sports and entertainment, along with special segments and guest interviews with some of the biggest names to give a unique experience.

programme.title: Get Up
programme.desc: Mike Greenberg, who joined ESPN in 1996 as an anchor, joins former NBA star Jalen Rose for roundtable discussions about the latest sports news making headlines as well as analysis of recent big games and interviews with expert commentators.

programme.title: 2025 NCAA Women's Basketball Tournament
programme.desc: North Carolina (29-7) and Duke (28-7) split two regular-season meetings, including a 53-46 Tar Heels win in overtime on Jan. 9 behind an Alyssa Ustby double-double before a 68-53 Blue Devils victory on Feb. 27 behind 23 points from Reigan Richardson.

programme.title: NCAA Championship In the Studio
programme.desc: Analyst and SportsCenter anchor Elle Duncan is joined by experts Rebecca Lobo and Andraya Carter as they discuss the upcoming action in the 2024 Women's NCAA Tournament with breakdowns of matchups and keys to the game with highlights and analysis.

programme.title: 2025 NCAA Women's Basketball Tournament
programme.desc: Maryland (25-7) defeated Alabama, 111-108, in double OT behind 28 points from Shyanne Sellers; South Carolina (32-3), the defending champions, earned its 10th-straight Sweet 16 berth with a 64-53 win over Indiana behind a Chloe Kitts double-double.

programme.title: MLB Baseball
programme.desc: Tarik Skubal finished last season with an 18-4 record and 2.39 ERA with 228 strikeouts for the strikeouts; Blake Snell struck out 145 batters in 104 innings before signing with the Dodgers.

programme.title: 2025 NCAA Women's Basketball Tournament
programme.desc: Ole Miss (22-10) used a strong second half to beat Baylor, 69-63, and advance behind 16 points from Sira Thienou; UCLA (32-2) makes its third-straight Sweet 16 appearance after an 84-67 win over Richmond behind 30 points from Lauren Betts.

programme.title: 2025 NCAA Women's Basketball Tournament
programme.desc: Oklahoma (27-7) blew out Iowa, 96-62, to advance behind 17 points from Skylar Vann; UConn (33-3) makes its 31st-straight Sweet 16 appearance after a 91-57 win over South Dakota State behind 34 points from Paige Bueckers and 17 from Azzi Fudd.

programme.title: NWSL Soccer
programme.desc: Orlando claimed a 1-0 victory over San Diego in their first meeting of the 2024 season before playing to a 1-1 draw in the final matchup on June 7; the Pride's Julie Doyle had opened the scoring in the draw while Makenzy Doniak equalized.

programme.title: College GameDay

programme.title: College Softball
programme.desc: Oklahoma enters the series having claimed a 9-0 victory against Tennessee in their last meeting on June 3, 2023, behind a team-leading 3 RBIs from Tiare Jennings; Kinzie Hansen and Rylie Boone contributed a pair of RBIs each in the win.

programme.title: UFL Football
programme.desc: Michigan finished second in the USFL Conference last season at 7-3, including a 35-18 road win over the Showboats on April 28 behind Wes Hills; Memphis beat Houston to end the 2024 season, 19-12, to stop an eight-game losing skid and finish 2-8.

programme.desc: Mikaela Mayer (20-2-0, 5 KOs) defends her WBO World welterweight title for the first time against Sandy Ryan (7-2-1, 3 KOs), who she defeated for the title back on Sept. 27 via majority decision at Madison Square Garden in New York.

programme.title: UFL Football

programme.title: UFC Fight Night Prelims
programme.desc: Scheduled UFC on ESPN 64 preliminary bouts: Edgar Chavez (11-6-0) vs. CJ Vergara (12-6-1) in a flyweight bout; Jose Daniel Medina (11-4) vs. Ateba Gautier (1-0) in a middleweight bout; Christian Rodriguez (12-2) vs. Melquizael Costa (22-7).

programme.title: College Hockey
programme.desc: Penn State comes off of a 4-3 overtime defeat to Ohio State in the Big Ten semifinals on March 15 with a goal and assist from Matt DiMarsico; Maine beat Connecticut, 5-2, in the Hockey East Championship on March 21 behind a Taylor Makar brace.

programme.title: League One Volleyball
programme.desc: Austin and Madison split wins in their first two meetings of the 2025 season with Madison claiming a 3-0 victory in the most recent matchup on March 1; Lauren Carlini posted 40 assists in the sweep at home while Annie Drews Schumacher added 17 kills.

programme.title: The Fight Life
programme.desc: Teofimo Lopez has his eyes set on reigning WBO junior welterweight world champion Josh Taylor, but after several subpar bouts, including dropping his lightweight title, Lopez feels he has a lot to prove he is still a champion boxer.

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: The Lakers beat Philadelphia in the NBA Finals in 1980, 1982 and 1983, while Boston won the crown by beating Houston in 1981; Los Angeles and Boston staged the first of three epic battles in 1984, and the rivalry transformed fans' view of the game.

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: In 1978, the Celtics drafted Larry Bird, but he played his final year at Indiana State before signing; Los Angeles selected Magic Johnson No. 1 in 1979 after he led Michigan State to a victory over Bird and the Sycamores in the NCAA title game.

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: The Lakers and Celtics met in the NBA Finals for the first time in 1959, and in the 1960s the two franchises battled for the title six times; Bill Russell was a dominant figure for the Celtics, and Los Angeles featured Jerry West and Elgin Baylor.

programme.desc: Big-money poker events in some of Europe's most exclusive and exciting destinations, features some of the best players in the world attempting to take huge pots by employing the right strategy and taking advantage of their opponents' mistakes.

programme.title: TMZ Sports Weekend
programme.desc: The biggest sports stories and rumors of the week are covered, as the analysts break down the news surrounding each of the headlines to discuss how those involved will be impacted, along with guest interviews to get an intriguing look at sports.

programme.title: Australian Football League
programme.desc: Geelong (1-1-0) fell to St. Kilda. 98-91, in Round 2; Brisbane (2-0-0) has won two of the past three encounters against the Cats, including a 95-65 victory last season in the Preliminary Finals at MCG, as Ollie Henry had four goals from 15 disposals.

programme.title: UFL Football
programme.desc: St. Louis went 7-3 last season to win the XFL Conference, including a 22-8 win over the Roughnecks on May 4 behind 134 receiving yards and two touchdowns from Hakeem Butler; Houston dropped its last six games to finish the 2024 season at 1-9.

programme.title: UFL Football

programme.title: Horse Racing
programme.desc: Cornucopian, trained by Bob Baffert and ridden by John Velazquez, is the early 7-5 favorite in the 1 1/8-mile race with a field of nine 3-year-olds and a purse of $1.5 million; Sandman is the 3-1 second choice in the Kentucky Derby prep race.

programme.title: College Softball
programme.desc: Creighton claimed a 2-0 sweep over Conncecticut in the 2024 Big East Tournament semi-finals round on May 10, winning game 2 with a 10-6 scoreline; Alyssa Gappa posted a game-leading 6 RBIs for the Bluejays in the postseason win at home.

programme.title: PBA Bowling
programme.desc: The third major tournament of the 2025 season features 15 games of qualifying over three days with the top 63 players plus the defending champion competing in the double-elimination match-play bracket; DeeRonn Booker is the defending champion.

programme.title: NHRA Drag Racing
programme.desc: Shawn Langdon leads Antron Brown in Top Fuel by 40 points, Paul Lee leads Jack Beckman in Funny Car by two points and Greg Anderson leads Dallas Glenn in Pro Stock by seven points after Phoenix, the second event of the 2025 season.

programme.title: MLB Baseball
programme.desc: Coverage of professional baseball.

programme.title: NHRA Qualifying
programme.desc: The top drag racers in the country attempt to make the show through qualifying times in Top Fuel, Funny Car, Pro Stock and other classifications; the drivers who qualify with the fastest times advance to the elimination rounds.

programme.desc: Players take to the Championship Court to compete in the semifinals in men's and women's doubles, mixed doubles, and men's and women's singles on the fourth day of the tournament; Anna Leigh Waters and Ben Johns headline the field.

programme.title: UFL Football
programme.desc: San Antonio missed winning the XFL Conference last season via a tiebreaker after going 7-3, including a 25-16 road win over the Renegades on April 27 behind John Lovett; Arlington won its last two games of the 2024 campaign but finished 3-7.

programme.title: MLB Baseball
programme.desc: New York Mets' Griffin Canning went 6-13 with a 5.19 ERA and 130 strikeouts over 171.2 innings in 32 appearances, including 31 starts last season; Houston's Yordan Alvarez has hit 30-plus home runs in each of the past four seasons.

programme.title: MLB Baseball
programme.desc: Coverage of professional baseball.

programme.title: NASCAR Cup Series
programme.desc: Kyle Larson secured his first Cup Series win of the season with his victory at Homestead over Alex Bowman, while William Byron holds onto his points lead; William Byron averaged 76.096 mph en route to his win last year over Larson.

programme.title: NASCAR Race Day
programme.desc: RaceDay previews the Cook Out 400 and Kyle Larson, who secured his first win of the season with a victory at Homestead over Alex Bowman, going over the latest news from pit road and updated track conditions, along with their predictions.

programme.title: Kevin Harvick's Happy Hour
programme.desc: Former NASCAR driver and 2014 Cup Series champion Kevin Harvick and his friends break down the latest news making headlines across NASCAR, going over the latest results and interview guests to gather their unique perspective on the sport.

programme.title: NASCAR Craftsman Truck Series Qualifying
programme.desc: Truck Series drivers attempt to qualify for the upcoming race in Martinsville and the driver with the fastest time is awarded the pole position; Ty Majeski averaged 97.523 mph en route to winning the pole last year before finishing in second.

programme.title: NRL Rugby League
programme.desc: Dolphins (0-0-3) is just 1-0-3 all-time against Brisbane (2-0-1) but won the last meeting with a 40-6 triumph last season at Suncorp Stadium in Round 26, as Jake Averillo, Hamiso Tabuai-Fidow and Herbie Farnworth each notched a brace.

programme.title: NRL Hits Vegas
programme.desc: The NRL stepped outside of Australia to open its 2024 season under the bright, neon lights of Las Vegas, as the documentary shows all-access footage and interviews with the people that made it happen and the players who got a unique experience.

programme.desc: San Antonio (7-3) led the UFL in total defense and scoring defense after allowing just 256.7 yards per game and 15.3 points per contest; St. Louis (7-3) won both encounters against the Brahmas this season after its 13-12 triumph at home in Week 10.

programme.title: UFL Football
programme.desc: Birmingham defeated Michigan, 31-18, to advance behind two passing TDs from Matt Corral; San Antonio beat St. Louis, 25-15, and won its season meeting with the Stallions, 18-9, on May 25 behind two rushing touchdowns from Morgan Ellison.
